Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Direttore della serie "Frontiers in History of Science" dell'editore Birkhäuser (Springer). 7 volumi attualmente in preparazione.

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: Relatore: “Spazio sferico e geometria della percezione”, Lessico Intellettuale Europeo, Roma; January 30-31, 2008.
Relatore: “Time and Motion in Leibniz's Metaphysics: the debate between Hans Reichenbach and Dietrich Mahnke”, Archives Henri Poincaré, Nancy; April 3-5, 2008.
Relatore: "Leibniz and Kant on the Parallel Postulate”, Intersections between Mathematics and Philosophy in the Thought of Leibniz, École Normale Supérieure, Paris; March 8-10, 2010.
Relatore: “The Kantian Proof of the Fifth Postulate”, XI. Internationaler Kant-Kongress; Pisa, May 22-26, 2010.
Relatore: “Leibniz’s Analysis Situs and the Localization of Monads”, in IX. Internationaler Leibniz-Kongress, Hannover; September 26-30, 2011.
Relatore: “Imagination and Geometry: Remarks on Kant's Theory of Space Perception”, in Fechner Day 2011, Herzliya, Israel; October 24-27, 2011.
Relatore: “Proving an Axiom qua Axiom. On the Mathematical Epistemology of Gerolamo Saccheri”, in Midwest PhilMath Workshop, Notre Dame University (USA); November 3-6, 2011.

Relatore: “Potenzialità e attualità degli oggetti geometrici nella prima età moderna”, in Il concetto di 'potenza' in età moderna, Istituto Nazionale di Studi sul Rinascimento, Firenze; December 15-17, 2011.

Relatore: “The Birth of Space in the Renaissance: from Metaphysics to Geometry”, in Spaces, Knots and Bonds: at the crossroads between early modern “magic” and “science”, Paris Observatory and Université Paris Diderot, Paris; June 21-23, 2012.

Organizer of: Space, Geometry and the Imagination from Antiquity to the Early Modern Age, a cooperation between the Max Planck Institute for the History of Science and the Centro di Ricerca Matematica “Ennio De Giorgi” (Scuola Normale Superiore, Pisa), Berlin; August 27-29, 2012 with Henry Mendell, Alexander Jones, David Rabouin, Franco Farinelli, Gary Hatfield, Douglas Jesseph, Andrew Janiak, Daniel Garber, Graciela De Pierris, Jeremy Gray, Michael Friedman
Relatore: “Francesco Patrizi e la nuova geometria dello spazio”, in Locus/Spatium: XIV International Colloquium, Lessico Intellettuale Europeo, Roma; January 3-5, 2013.

Relatore: “The Arabic Attempts to Prove the Parallel Postulate and their Early Modern Reception” in Philosophy and Mathematics, Centre d'Histoire des Sciences et des Philosophies Arabes et Médiévales; Paris, March 21, 2013
Organizer of: Kant and the Euclidean Tradition, MPIWG; April 24, 2013 with Daniel Sutherland, Jeremy Heis, Erik Banks
Organizer of: J.H. Lambert: Science and Epistemology, MPIWG; April 25, 2013 with Alison Laywine, Thomas Morel, Marteen Bullynck, Norbert Schappacher, Christophe Eckes, Paola Basso
Organizer of: Finite Geometry, Indivisibles and Minima from the Middle Age to the 18th Century, MPIWG; May 29, 2013 with Sander De Boer, Angelika Bönker-Vallon, Richard T.W. Arthur, Douglas Jesseph
Relatore: “What does it mean to (indirectly) prove the Parallel Postulate? Some developments in mathematical epistemology from Euclid to Lambert”, PhilMath Intersem 4, Paris; June 4, 2013.

Organizer of: Geometry and Logic: The Shape of Mathematical Proofs from Antiquity to the Early Modern Age, a cooperation between the Max Planck Institute for the History of Science and the Centro di Ricerca Matematica “Ennio De Giorgi” (Scuola Normale Superiore, Pisa), Pisa; June 17-19, 2013 with Ken Saito, Monica Ugaglia, Heike Sefrin-Weis, Orna Harari, Roshdi Rashed, Sabine Rommevaux, Paolo Freguglia, Paolo Mancosu, Massimo Mugnai, Alison Laywine, Andrew Arana, Victor Pambuccian, Claudio Bartocci
Relatore: “Constitui, dico, non componi. Leibniz on points and space”, in Ideas of point, SISSA, Trieste; November 14-16, 2013.

Organizer of: Geometrical, Astronomical and Geographical Notions of Space in the Renaissance, MPIWG; May 19, 2014. with Matthias Schemmel, Henrique Leitao, Adam Mosley, Jean-Marc Besse, Anna De Pace, Michela Malpangotto

Organizer of: The Mechanization of Geometry from Antiquity to the Early Modern Age, a cooperation between the Max Planck Institute for the History of Science and the Centro di Ricerca Matematica “Ennio De Giorgi” (Scuola Normale Superiore, Pisa), Berlin; June 23-25, 2014 with Reviel Netz, Antoni Malet, Marco Panza, Daniel Garber, Richard Arthur, George Smith, Helmut Pulte, Michael Friedman, Matthias Schemmel, Angela Axworthy

Organizer of: Leibniz and Geometry, a cooperation between the Max Planck Institute for the History of Science and the Max Planck Institute for the Mathematics in the Sciences (Leipzig), Leipzig; June 30 – July 1, 2014 with Eberhard Knobloch, Siegmund Probst, David Rabouin, Valérie Debuiche, Daniel Garber, Richard Arthur, Edward Slowik, Massimo Mugnai, Vincenzo De Risi
Relatore: “Leibniz and non-Euclidean Geometry”, HOPOS 2014, Ghent; July 3-6, 2014.

Relatore: “Apollonius’s Book Six of the Conics and its Reception in the Early Modern Age”, in Aspects of Apollonius’ Conic Sections, Excellence Cluster TOPOI, Humboldt Universität, Berlin; July 10-12, 2014.
“Leibniz and the Localization of Monads”, Colloquium Series of Suppes Center for History and Philosophy of Science, Stanford University; February 6, 2015.
Relatore: “Leibniz’s Geometry of Space”, Colloquium Series of the HPS Department of the University of California Irvine; February 13, 2015.
Relatore: The Foundations of Geometry in the Early Modern Period”, Colloquium Series of the Philosophy Department of McGill University, Montréal; February 20, 2015.
Relatore: The Development of Euclidean Axiomatics”, McMaster Speaker Series, McMaster University, Hamilton (Toronto); February 27, 2015.
Relatore: “Leibniz’ Epistemology of Geometry”, Colloquium Series of the Philosophy Department of Princeton University; March 26, 2015.

Organizer of: Wallis and Barrow on Geometry and Space, Université Paris Diderot - MPIWG; May 26, 2015, and June 12, 2015. with Philip Beeley, Niccolò Guicciardini, Jesper Lützen, Antoni Malet, Marco Panza, Siegmund Probst, Edward Slowik, Moredechai Feingold, Ian Stewart

Relatore: “Axioms and Postulates in Early Modern Edition of the Elements”, in Les éditions et réécritures des Eléments d'Euclide et la question des fondements, Université Paris-Diderot, Paris; June 15, 2015.
Relatore: “Lambert’s Theory of Definitions”, Colloquium Series of the History of Science Society of Copenhagen; June 16, 2015.
Relatore: “The Theory of Parallels in 18th-century Germany”, in 1750-1850: ruptures et continuités en géométrie, Archives Henri Poincaré, Nancy; June 25-26, 2015.

Organizer of: The Science of Space in the Early Modern Age, Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, Berlin; July 6-8,2015 with John Mumma, David M. Miller, Marius Stan, Valérie Debuiche, Delphine Bellis, Davide Crippa, Tal Glezer, Tzuchien Tho, Angela Axworthy
Relatore: “Ibn al-Haytham on the Foundations of Geometry”, in The Islamic Golden Age of Science for an actual knowledge-based society, UNESCO, Paris; September 14-15, 2015.
Relatore: “Magnitude and Structure: Geometry and Philosophy of Space in the Early Modern Age”, Colloquium Series of the Philosophy Department of Notre Dame University; February 12, 2016.
“Leibniz’s Theory of Space”, Colloquium Series of the Philosophy Department of Princeton University; March 4, 2016.
Relatore: “Leibniz and non-Euclidean Geometry”, in Calculemus: Philosophical visions for Mathematics, University of Trento; May 23, 2016.
Relatore: “The axiomatization of space in the modern editions of Euclid’s Elements”, PhilMath Intersem 7, Paris; June 2, 2016.
Relatore: “John Wallis on the Foundations of Geometry”, in John Wallis (1616-1703). Mathematics, Music Theory, and Cryptography in 17th Century Oxford, Oxford University; June 9th, 2016.
Relatore: “Kant’s Theory of Space and Empirical Schematism”, in Critical Connections - An International Kant Conference, Tel Aviv University; June 20-23, 2016.
Relatore: “Leibniz on the Continuity of Space”, in X. Internationaler Leibniz-Kongress, Hannover; July 18-23, 2016.

Co-organizer of: Theatrum naturae et artium. Leibniz und die Schauplätze der Aufklärung, a cooperation between the Sächsische Akademie der Wissenschaften (Leipzig) and the University of Leipzig, Leipzig; September 28-30, 2016 with Robert Brandom, Maria Rosa Antognazza, Helmut Pulte, Ursula Goldenbaum, Monika Fick, Karin Reich, Mogens Lærke, Martin Mulsow, Veronika Albrecht-Birkner, Friedemann Stengel, Michael Multhammer, Udo Sträter, Vincenzo De Risi, Siegmund Probst, David Rabouin, Enrico Pasini, Pirmin Stekeler-Weithofer, Daniel Fulda, Anett Lütteken, Wolfram Malte Fues, Ingo Uhlig, Nadja Reinhard, Avi Lifschitz, Andreas Erb, Friedrich Waitz von Eschen, Hans Poser, Wenchao Li, Clemens Schwaiger, Marie-Hélène Quéval, Günther Arnold, Stefan Lorenz, Gregory Grämiger, Karin Löffler, Flemming Schock, Martin Saar, Andreas Blank, Luca Basso, Ansgar Lyssy, Alexandra Lewendoski, Eberhard Knobloch, Paolo Bussotti, Tzuchien Tho, Paolo Rubini, Harald Siebert
Relatore: “Leibniz on the Continuity of Space”, in Leibniz and the Sciences, University of Milan; October 7-8, 2016.
Relatore: “Saccheri’s Spherical Geometry”, in UMI Conference, Pavia; October 9, 2016.

Organizer of: Leibniz and the Sciences, a cooperation between the Max Planck Institute for the Mathematics in the Sciences (Leipzig) and the University of Leipzig, Leipzig; November 14-16, 2016 with Eberhard Knobloch, Daniel Garber, Richard Arthur, Maria Rosa Antognazza, François Duchesneau, Justin Smith, Philip Beeley, André Wakefield, Martin Carrier, Jürgen Jost, Claus Kiefer

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Visiting Scholar presso lo History and Philosophy of Science Department, University of Pittsburgh, April 1 - June 30, 2007.
Alexander von Humboldt Fellow, Technische Universität, Berlin
Research Group Director, Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, Berlin
Leibniz Professor, Research Academy, University of Leipzig Visiting Full Professorship (W3/C4).

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Direttore del Gruppo di Ricerca "Modern Geometry and the Concept of Space" presso il Max Planck Institute for the History of Science, Berlin
Relatore: “Proving an Axiom qua Axiom. On the Mathematical Epistemology of Gerolamo Saccheri”, in The Classical Model of Science, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam; August 2-5, 2011.

Organizer of: Max Planck Colloquium 2011-2015, Max Planck Institute for the History of Science with Marius Stan, Alison Laywine, David Miller, Michael Friedman, Delphine Bellis, Valérie Debuiche, Bernardo Mota, John Mumma, Pietro Omodeo, Andrew Arana, Matthias Schemmel, Francesca Biagioli, Fabio Acerbi, Tal Glezer, Henny Blomme, Davide Crippa, Angela Axworthy, Henry Zepeda, Tzuchien Tho, Jacqueline Feke, Eduardo Giovannini, Claudio Bartocci, Sabine Rommevaux, Sara Confalonieri, Luca Guzzardi, Thomas Morel, Athanase Papadopoulos, Paolo Mancosu, Katherine Dunlop, Daniel Sutherland, Tawrin Baker, Hannes Matthiessen, Eunsoo Lee, Nabeel Hamid.

Membro del Gruppo di Ricerca "Leibniz, Newton and Beyond: History and Philosophy of Mathematics from the 17th to the 19th Century”, Centro di Ricerca Matematica “Ennio De Giorgi”, Scuola Normale Superiore, Pisa.
Relatore: “The Meaning of Principles in Ancient Mathematical Texts”, in Bucharest Master Class on “Principles in Early Modern Thought”, Bucharest; March 15-18, 2016.
